BBC's Sherlock. Even now, after I've finished watching it MONTHS ago, I still can't forget about it. It's REALLY VERY good, at first I wasn't really into it but after watching the first episode I was hooked. (I won't go into detail anymore, since people are probably saying a lot as to how it's all very good and YES, it really is.)

... My only problem now is the fact that the next Season is STILL so far off... and probably just 3 eps AND with another cliffhanger at the end like this season and I'd have to suffer through all THIS again. ... Oh God... 

Moffat and Gatiss can't be THAT evil... right? ... Right?

To those who don't know it yet: Ryan Reynolds was also hired by DC to play Hal Jordan for the Green Lantern the Movie. He played Wade Wilson (Deadpool) in the Wolverine Origins and Barakapool (I just can't bring myself to call it Deadpool) and there's going to be a movie with Deadpool too. Yeah they have a bit of a problem now.

Please Ryan Reynolds please make a GOOD Deadpool movie T_T
Also because it's adorable XD found it over at digg, and it should atleast uplift some spirits over these troubled times~ and because I haven't been posting anything in a while XD

SO...! In lieu of 5 more additions to our cat family (we now have 15... holy...) we really need to find homes for the kittens and in the future homes for the 5 other kittens. I love them to bits but there really is far too many cats in our house that even I can't take care of them. Yes. I know we should do something about it, negotiations is STILL going regarding that matter, but I'd like to say I TOLD YOU SO to the other party. Because I did, I really really did. So don't blame me for the fluffy population explosion. And here's Tim following the footsteps of his mother... I really don't understand why they like playing with my bed covers but they do. Jason ponders the meaning of life... and the string that's dangling off camera. Richard (Dick lol XD) tring to get the treat from the chair and pretending that no one can see him do it.
http://community.livejournal.com/cat_macros/5144773.html?view=43165893#t43165893 XD It's just too cute

Wade was alright but when they turned him into Deadpool... (Ryan Reynolds is alright for Deadpool and as Wade, I have nothing against him. What I'm irked about is what the writers did to him in the end... SERIOUSLY WTF people!) =_=

So now something that would make the Deadpool fan in me better~

IT Head Responsibilities: * In-charge in the software development especially in accounting program. * Create intranet system. Requirements: * Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Post Graduate Diploma / Master's Degree or Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam) in Engineering (Computer/Telecommunication), Computer Science/Information Technology or equivalent. * Required skill(s): software development, intranet system. * At least 5 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. * Preferably Assistant Manager / Managers specializing in IT/Computer - Software or equivalent. Job role in Software Engineer/Programmer or System Analyst. * Full-Time positions available. * Applicants should be Filipino citizens or hold relevant residence status. Preventive Maintenance Head Responsibilities: * In-charge with the overall preventive maintenance program of vehicles specifically armored car units. Requirements: * Candidate must possess at least a Vocational Diploma / Short Course Certificate or Bachelor's/College Degree in Engineering (Mechanical), Logistic/Transportation or equivalent. * Required skill(s): Driving, computer literate, preventive maintenance experience. * Required language(s): Filipino, English * At least 5 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. * Preferably Assistant Manager / Managers specializing in Engineering - Mechanical/Automotive or equivalent. Job role in Mechanical Engineer or Automotive Engineer. * Full-Time positions available. * Applicants should be Filipino citizens or hold relevant residence status. If you're interested, you can contact us . Address: CMI Building 315 Commonwealth Avenue, Diliman, Quezon City, Philippines Trunklines: 951-1515; 16; 20; 24; 25 loc: 218, 229 or 253 ask for Ms. Les or Ms. Tanya Email: mdrequito_2003@yahoo.com

I got from my officemate. Hope this helps.

"My pamangkin, Kuya Ken's son Matthew, where we took the other half of the business namesake was abducted last night at Festival Mall in Alabang.

Name: Matthew" Chu-chu" David Samudio
Age: 3 Years Old, Can barely speak straight.
Address: 16 guyabano st umali rd. summitville subdivision putatan muntinlupa city 1770

He was last seen at Tom's World Arcade in Festival Mall Alabang, around 8pm yesterday July 22, 2008 wearing Green Checkered Polo, Maong pants and Green Mr. Bean Slippers.

When we reviewed the surveillance camera in said mall, there was this chubby impoverished looking girl around 12-13 years old wearing a dirtied pink top with floral design and a reddish jogging pants who summoned my nephew and then whispered something to him, then my pamangkin who is very "bibo" readily took her hand as they went out of the said premises.

Guys, I need your help with this, if you know people in the media, police or government agency who might be able to HELP us locate my nephew, I'm begging you, please, please help us. Or at the very least, please pass this message to as many people as possible, who knows where the abductors might have taken him... Matthew is a very sickly kid, he rarely eats unless his yaya feeds him and he was about to have an operation for fluid in his right testis.

If there are any news or lead that can locate my nephew, please help us... Sobrang kawawa ang pamangkin ko, who knows how they are treating him...I dont want this thing happening to any kid so please help my nephew. PLEASE. You can contact my brother at 0923-638-4632.

Thank you so much and God Bless you!"

There's a link to the multiply site as well as the photos here:http://melquita.multiply.com/photos/album/348/#

I saw this while going through my usual rounds in the net. It's just amusing that's all.

"Following the announcement of the new Flying-HK-style "Reaper" death machines for the British forces (http://www.theregister.co.uk/2007/05/10/the_flying_hk_are_coming_aiee/), the prophetic nature of the Terminator movies has been further confirmed.

Not only will the UK MoD deploy airborne cyber-gunships remarkably similar to those in the films, the flying robot assassins will be controlled by an IT project named "Skynet"."

http://www.theregister.co.uk/2007/05/11/skynet_takes_control/

I suppose we better stock up on ammo in our underground bunkers just incase Terminator Armageddon comes up or something. XD

I've now gone through my fanfic stage... I think and I'm currently surfing the net for interesting news articles and what not. Since these articles are from the internet I'm not sure of how true these are but I really wish they ARE real because I'd want to get my hands on them too XD. Following up on my Ironman high (Batman is still cooler than Ironman >_> ) I started looking for articles about it and came up with: Robot Exoskeletons... oh and that Mecha looking thing from Mech Warrior and Robotcop's enemy XD Yes I know. I keep on stumbling over really weird sites but it's how one learns new things I suppose. First one, I have to say it really looks like a robot from TV. It's like a prototype for a Mecha. It reminds me of that robot thingy from Robocop, those white things from Star Wars (they were in the part where they were attack the rebel in this snow covered place...) and yes that Mecha from Mech Warrior like so: The site is here: http://66.196.80.202/babelfish/translate_url_content?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sakakibara-kikai.co.jp%2Fproducts%2Fother%2FLW.htm&lp=ja_en&fr=avbbf-us&.intl=us Second one is an exoskeleton that sort of enhances your strength sort of like the first robot built by Tony Stark in Ironman the movie except that it doesn't fly and it doesn't have a flame thrower. This one comes from a news paper article so I suppose it's true... http://www.telegraph.co.uk/earth/main.jhtml?view=DETAILS&grid=&xml=/earth/2008/04/25/sciiron125.xml Next up is something that's supposed to help the US military carry more load. Article over yonder: http://machinedesign.com/ContentItem/59305/Givingsoldiersahightechlegup.aspx Last but not the least, this one they're actually selling it already. Article over here~ http://www.newscientist.com/blog/technology/2008/05/exoskeletons-for-sale-finally.html Oh and there's apparently an article that's about exoskeletons XD http://www.environmentalgraffiti.com/sciencetech/5-bionic-exoskeleton-suits-of-the-future/1137 For the record I'm not a Mecha fan anime/tv show-wise (only anime that I like that has robots in it is Gurenn Laggan), but I really do love new technology in real life. XD I'd want my own in the future.

Hey everyone~ please add http://rmpf.deviantart.com/ to your deviantart accounts :D they have really good art here X3

CCJrs: yesh this is where Z-chan works XD

I've driven more than 400 miles in a day/been in a car that went more than 400 miles in a day.

LEAF was formed September of 1994 by it's Lead Guitarist Dean Russell and his Cousin Drummer Jay and experienced different line-up changes until now (Long Story...).

Most members of the band are based in Pasig City. With their melodic songs and heavy riffs, LEAF remains true to their sound despite all the current trends surrounding the Music Industry. Influenced with bands such as Black Sabbath, Deep Purple, and Led Zeppelin and blending them with their own style.

Right now, the band had recorded 6 original songs from their own Monochrome Studios and are currently tracking vocal cuts.

requirements?

 - can carry a tune
 - has his own style especially since this band have their own original songs
 - willing to bond and blend with his bandmates
 - shares the rock and roll dream
 - willing to work from the ground up
 - substance over style
 - loves music

for more info go to this link ^^ http://talk.philmusic.com/board/index.php/topic,86000.0.html

and no I'm not a member, I'm posting it because the guitarist is the one teaching me how to play the guitar ^^

A funny thing happened to me this morning when I was heading to work.

<lj-cut text="You see a wile, you thwart. Am I right?">

It was more or less the typical morning for me, except for the fact that I didn't notice the time and I left home late. (Around 3 minutes late, it's not much but when you live in my house it's already a VERY BIG thing.) So I had to rush my long and grueling walk from the very end of SM North to the other end of Trinoma (Landmark entrance) and realized that I've forgotten my Globe button thingy. Therefore I had to line up (and get pushed around) by the people trying to get their own Fare Card.

That done, I (thankfully) found a seat and started reading the new book I bought: Good Omens. (Yes after going around bookstores and bookstores, I finally found a copy when I was in Trinoma with <lj user="hiddenpsyche"> last night). After nearly missing my stop I sort of threw myself out of the train (looking harassed because the lady in front of me that took up most space didn't budge even after a whole round of 'Excuse me...! Excuse me please...!'), and headed up the stairs.

And then I saw it.

Someone must've dropped their rosary at the top of the stairs. It was made out of wood and looked like the ones nuns used. I just sort of stared at it while holding onto my book on one hand.

My first thought was: What the hell?

Good Omens still fresh in my mind, I started giggling and picked up the rosary then handed it to the security guard on my way out of the station.
